imdb.title: Tenisu no ôjisama
imdb.plot: Prince of Tennis follows the story of a 12 year old boy Ryoma Echizen who won four consecutive titles in the American Junior Tennis tournaments. He's an amazing tennis player and is considered a prodigy. He moved from America to J...

episodes.title: Ôjisama arawaru
episodes.plot: Twelve-year-old tennis prodigy Ryoma Echizen takes down Sasabe the bully easily with his advanced tennis game.

episodes.title: Samurai junia
episodes.plot: Ryoma's first day at Seishun Academy, also known as "Seigaku." He rescues Horio, a seventh grader being picked on by two older tennis team members. He easily dispatches them, piquing the interest of Takeshi Momoshiro, a tennis team regular.

episodes.title: Tôjô! Seigaku regyurâ
episodes.plot: Arai tries to get his revenge on Ryoma. He hides Ryoma's rackets and challenges him to a match, forcing him to play with an old and broken racket. All the while the Seigaku team members observe Ryoma closely.

episodes.title: Mamushi to yobareru otoko
episodes.plot: Ryoma has been chosen by Captain Kunimitsu Tezuka to play for a spot on the regular team, a first for a seventh grader. His main opponent is Kaoru Kaido, infamous for his "Snake Shot" and reptilian nature.

episodes.title: Suneiku shotto
episodes.plot: Ryoma patiently plays Kaido's game while gathering information crucial to voiding his dangerous "Snake Shot." Ryoma counters effectively, amazing all who watch.

episodes.title: Sono otoko, echizen nanjirô
episodes.plot: Mr. Inoue from Monthly Pro Tennis magazine goes to interview Ryoma's quirky and lazy father Nanjiro. Rebuffing his questions, Nanjiro challenges Inoue to a game of tennis.

episodes.title: Futari no ryôma
episodes.plot: Ryoma's next opponent in the ranking matches is Sadaharu Inui, a scientific and methodical tennis player whose data never fails him.

episodes.title: Supuritto suteppu
episodes.plot: Ryoma unleashes his secret weapon, "the split step," which makes him respond to Sadaharu's attacks quicker and clouds Sadaharu's predictions of Ryoma's game.

episodes.title: Za hâdo dei
episodes.plot: Ryoma defeats Sadaharu and wins a spot on the regular team. Sadaharu isn't out of the picture though--he stays on to help train the regulars and introduce them to his special concoction: a vegetable drink guaranteed to make them stronger.

episodes.title: Gyakushû! Sasabe futatabi
episodes.plot: Sasabe has returned! Only this time it's his father who's the troublemaker, making a fun day at Kachiro's father's tennis club a nightmare. Ryoma tries to diffuse the situation slyly by asking Mr. Sasabe to teach him tennis.

episodes.title: Ryôma vs. Momoshiro!
episodes.plot: Ryoma and Momo are developing a competitive friendship. They both have their eyes on the #3 doubles spot so they decide to play each other for it. At the outdoor tennis courts they come upon a round-robin doubles game.

episodes.title: A un na futari
episodes.plot: Although they lost to Fukawa and Izumi, Ryoma and Momo decide to challenge themselves and play doubles at the district matches. Coincidentally, their opponents there are Gyokurin's Fukawa and Izumi, again.

episodes.title: Otoko wa daburusu!
episodes.plot: In the midst of their uncoordinated game with Fukawa and Izumi, Ryoma and Momo bring their game back with an interesting yet unorthodox way to synchronize their attack.

episodes.title: Tsubame gaeshi!
episodes.plot: The mysterious team from Fudomine Junior High comes out of nowhere to defeat a seeded school. Shusuke Fuji and Taka Kawamura are up to play them in doubles. Everybody is amazed at Shusuke's Triple counter shot, but Mr. Inoue doubts it'll be a win for Seigaku!

episodes.title: Sore zore no tatakai
episodes.plot: Fudomine's Ishida breaks out his secret weapon--the "Wave Surge" shot--to bring the momentum back to their team. As Shusuke prepares to return the invincible flat shot meant for him, Taka steps in and intercepts it.

episodes.title: Bûmeran suneiku
episodes.plot: Eiji Kikumaru and Shuichiro Oishi win their doubles match over Fudomine, and Kaoru Kaido begins his match against Fudomine's Akira Kamio. Kaido is pushed by Akira's speedy game and is forced to use his specialty "Snake Shot," but he slips!

episodes.title: Chiisana gattsu pôzu
episodes.plot: Kaido's new move "The Boomerang Snake" ends up amazing everyone and himself! He regains his confidence and restarts his strategy--to tenaciously wear down a player and finish them off with one strike.

episodes.title: Raburetâ
episodes.plot: Ryoma starts his match with Fudomine's Shinji Ibu, and Coach Ryuzaki remembers when Ryoma's father Nanjiro was a student of hers.

episodes.title: Kizu darake no ryôma
episodes.plot: Ryoma injures his eye as he tries to bounce back from a series of shots from Shinji Ibu. Ibu's shots were strategically chosen to momentarily paralyze Ryoma. Ryoma isn't giving up despite his injury, so Captain Tezuka gives him ten minutes to in the match.

episodes.title: Taimu rimitto
episodes.plot: The Seigaku Team watches intently as Ryoma figures out a brilliant strategy--a combination of his split step and his father's "two-sword style"--to shut down Ibu's "spot."

episodes.title: Tenisu kôto wa moeteiruka?
episodes.plot: Seigaku's recent success at the district matches attracts unwanted attention and "spies" from rival schools, desperately trying to gather any sort of data they can. Two of these spies, Shunsuke and Kenzo, end up challenging Momo and Ryoma to a match.

episodes.title: Kaoru no sainan
episodes.plot: It's after practice. Kaoru goes off to train but Ryoma, Momo, Horio, Kachiro and Katsuo go shopping for supplies. On their way, they run into a purse-snatcher. Momo "borrows" a bike and chases the culprit. Momo's asking for trouble because the bike he takes is Akira Kamio's!

episodes.title: Tôjô! Inui jiru derakkusu
episodes.plot: It's nine days away from the Metropolitan Tournament! Captain Tezuka and Inui introduce a new way to train. The team members are separated based on their style of play and rally against each other. If a player loses they have to drink a new and "improved" version of Sadaharu's vegetable juice...

episodes.title: Ryôma no kyûitsu
episodes.plot: Coach Ryuzaki asks Ryoma to take Sakuno to restring her racket, but everybody else thinks he's taking her out on a date!

episodes.title: Seigaku saikyô no otoko part 1
episodes.plot: Captain Tezuka challenges Ryoma to a match because he feels Ryoma's tennis is a copy of his father's game, even though he is staking his own health. He wants to challenge Ryoma to aim higher, beyond just wanting to beat his father.

episodes.title: Seigaku saikyô no otoko part 2
episodes.plot: Shuichiro Oishi watches Tezuka and Ryoma play their game, worried that Tezuka may injure his already weakened arm. The other team members, who don't know of Tezuka's plan, grow suspicious seeing that their captain, Shuichiro, and Ryoma have missed two straight practices.

episodes.title: Karupin no bôken
episodes.plot: Ryoma accidentally packs his cat Kalpin's favorite toy in his tennis bag, and the cat follows him to school. When Ryoma finds out his cat is wandering around campus, the search is on to find Kalpin!

episodes.title: Shin regyurâ arawaru!?
episodes.plot: It's the day of the Metropolitan Tournament and Ryoma oversleeps, forcing his teammates to find a substitute for registration--Horio in a team jersey! Will the imposter be found out?

episodes.title: Momo to murashi
episodes.plot: Momo and Kaido are assigned to play doubles by Coach in the next match, but their stormy rivalry just might get in the way--or could it work to their advantage?

episodes.title: Mizuki no shinario
episodes.plot: The intense doubles match goes long, and Kaido finds that his snake is ineffective against the St. Rudolph duo. The pressure pushes Kaido to the brink and a new move is unleashed.

episodes.title: Mûnborê
episodes.plot: Next up is Seigaku's "golden pair," Kikumaru and Oishi, and the two find themselves facing some tough challengers. Ryoma notices that their opponent Akazawa's hits make the ball a blur--could this be the secret to their surprising success?

episodes.title: Hissatsu! Eiji no neta furi kôgeki!?
episodes.plot: Oishi and Kikumaru try the Australian Formation to gain the upper hand over the St. Rudolph pair. But when Kikumaru's energy starts to fade, their game is in jeopardy!

episodes.title: Taiburêku
episodes.plot: Kikumaru brilliantly revives his strength and breaks out his acrobatic moves, and the grueling doubles match with St. Rudolph goes into a tiebreak. Will Eiji be able to hold out to the end?

episodes.title: Tsuisuto supin shotto
episodes.plot: Ryoma Echizen's turn is finally up, and he faces Fuji's younger brother Yuta, who will stop at nothing to surpass his older brother.

episodes.title: Doraibu B
episodes.plot: Ryoma sees the secret behind Yuta's most powerful move and tells him to stop using it, as it will hurt him eventually. Ryoma then unveils his new move, the "Drive B."

episodes.title: Ani, Fuji Syûsuke
episodes.plot: Shusuke Fuji is up against the St. Rudolph mastermind Mizuki, but he isn't his usual cheerful self. Will Fuji be able to fend off Mizuki's data-driven tennis?

episodes.title: Ryôma jirushi no tenisu bôru
episodes.plot: It's Ryoma's day off, but Nanjiro tricks him into giving tennis lessons to Sakuno and Tomoka!

episodes.title: Penaruteî!
episodes.plot: Before Seigaku's tennis practice starts, a rival player from Yamabuki is seen on campus asking around for Ryoma and causing trouble. Meanwhile, Inui has some very special training planned.

episodes.title: Higuma otoshi!
episodes.plot: Inter-team practices are held before the Metropolitan Matches, and Ryoma and Fuji face off, each bringing out his most formidable moves to topple.

episodes.title: Ame no naka no kettô
episodes.plot: Ryoma and Fuji's match continues on with ferocity and the rest of the inter-team match up starts! Tezuka counters Momoshiro's smashes easily. Kaido's snake threatens to overpower Kawamura, and Oishi tests Kikumaru's stamina.

episodes.title: Haran!
episodes.plot: The second half of the Metropolitan Matches begins! Fudomine Junior High plays badly due to circumstances beyond their control and forfeits. Ginka Junior High also forfeits and Seigaku advances to the next match to play Yamabuki Junior High!

episodes.title: Nerawareta ôishi
episodes.plot: Kikumaru and Oishi start their doubles match against Yamabuki Junior High's Higashikata and Minami. Oishi confronts the same pair that he was unable to beat in last year's match. And finally Momoshiro's match with Sengoku starts!

episodes.title: Rakkî sengoku
episodes.plot: Sengoku counters Momoshiro's signature dunk smash and the match slowly starts shifting in his favor. Momoshiro perseveres but his left foot starts to spasm due to the intensity of the match.

episodes.title: Jakku naifu
episodes.plot: Finally Ryoma's match starts with Akutsu from Yamabuki Junior High. With all the trouble Ryoma encountered with Akutsu a few days ago, everyone is worried for his safety!

episodes.title: Kôto no ue no akuma
episodes.plot: Provoked by Ryoma's taunts, Akutsu begins to take their match seriously and unleash his true strength. Akutsu's power and speed amaze the crowd, while Ryoma counters with his special shots....

episodes.title: Samurai tamashii
episodes.plot: Ryoma brings out his best shots to challenge Akutsu's raw power. In spite of the spectators' worries, the violent battle continues to rage. Will Ryoma find the strength within to help him defeat his most challenging enemy?

episodes.title: Makerarenai!
episodes.plot: Evolving with each and every play, Ryoma holds his own, and the game is even! Coach Banda of the Yamabuki Jr. High team hands Akutsu a secret strategy. With a game he cannot lose, Akutsu makes his move.

episodes.title: Kecchaku no toki
episodes.plot: Ryoma is cornered by Akutsu. But he accepts this challenge head on and releases his newfound power. Each player steps closer to the next level without giving an inch, all the while throwing out his most powerful moves.

episodes.title: Ishu kakutô sen
episodes.plot: The Metropolitan Matches have ended and calm has returned to Seigaku, but a new storm starts brewing! Ryoma provokes a trio of bullies from the basketball team, and Tezuka is challenged by a student who appears unexpectedly on the scene!

episodes.title: Seigaku meibutsu!
episodes.plot: The inter-team matches begin! As always, the first years are surprised at how ruthlessly this challenge is organized. Despite the mental strain, the regular team members progress to the next round. But an unexpected player who has been waiting in the wings appears to face off with the block's biggest challenge, Tezuka!
